statements: UPDATE financial_data SET balance = 650.50, owner_name = 'Alice' WHERE id = 1234
UPDATE financial_data SET account_number = '7890123456', security_code = 'ABCD12' WHERE id = 5678
UPDATE financial_data SET balance = 5000.00, owner_name = 'John Doe' WHERE id = 100
UPDATE financial_data SET security_code = '123ABC', balance = 7000.50, account_number = 'A123456789' WHERE id = 200
UPDATE financial_accounts SET account_balance = 1500.50 WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE users SET email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE username = 'johndoe';
UPDATE financial_accounts SET account_balance = 2000.75 WHERE account_name = 'Savings' AND account_owner_id = 101
UPDATE users SET username = 'newusername' WHERE user_id = 201
UPDATE Users SET username = 'john_doe', email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE Accounts SET balance = 2500.00, user_id = 2 WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE Users SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE Accounts SET balance = balance + 1000 WHERE user_id = 1 AND balance > 0;
UPDATE customers SET first_name='John', last_name='Doe' WHERE customer_id=1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance=5000.00, account_type='Savings' WHERE account_id=101;
UPDATE customers SET first_name = 'John', last_name = 'Doe' WHERE customer_id = 123;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance + 1000.50 WHERE account_id = 456;
UPDATE customers SET address = '123 Main St' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = 5000.00 WHERE account_id = 1001;
UPDATE customers SET address='123 Main Street, New York' WHERE customer_id=1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance=2500.00 WHERE account_id=1001;
